Description: The Get-NetTCPConnection cmdlet gets current TCP connections. Use this cmdlet to view TCP connection properties such as local or remote IP address, local or remote port, and connection state.

Examples.Title: Example 1: Get all connections
Examples.Code:
PS C:\>Get-NetTCPConnection
This command gets all current TCP connections.

Examples.Title: Example 2: Get established connections
Examples.Code:
PS C:\>Get-NetTCPConnection –State Established
This command gets all TCP connections that have an Established state.

Examples.Title: Example 3: Get Internet TCP connections
Examples.Code:
PS C:\>Get-NetTCPConnection –AppliedSetting Internet
This command gets all TCP connections that use a TCP applied setting of Internet.
